description: From bull +‎ shit. In use since 1914.

adjectives.description: bullshit (comparative more bullshit, superlative most bullshit)

entries.meaning: (vulgar, slang) absurd, irrational, or nonsensical (Most often said of speech, information, or content.)
examples: That's the most bullshit excuse I've ever heard.

entries.meaning: (vulgar, literally) Feces produced by a bull.
(vulgar, slang, usual sense) Statements that are false or exaggerated to impress or cheat the listener.
examples: Don't pay any attention to him. He talks a lot of bullshit.

entries.meaning: (vulgar, slang) Statements that are transparently or offensively false.
examples: That's total bullshit! I called your office and they said that you didn't come in!
Fucking load of bullshit! You smashed his skull and dropped the F-bomb at him, and now you're claiming that he assaulted you?!

entries.meaning: (rhetoric) Statements that are intentionally misleading, whether true or not.
(philosophy) Statements made without regard for their truth value.
(vulgar, slang) Synonym of shit (in its sense of any stuff, especially when viewed negatively or with collegial vulgarity).
examples: These rules cover how to do your laundry, how to fold your shirts, how to shine your shoes... You know, all that bullshit.

entries.meaning: (card games, possibly vulgar) A card game in which players try to discard their hands first, following rules that encourage bluffing, calling others' bluffs, and penalizing others by tricking them into inaccurate accusations.
examples: Anyone want to play a few hands of bullshit?

verbs.description: bullshit (third-person singular simple present bullshits, present participle bullshitting, simple past and past participle bullshitted or bullshit or (rare) bullshat)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, vulgar, slang) To tell lies, exaggerate; to mislead; to deceive.
examples: I think you're bullshitting. Let’s just call your office and see if you even came in.
You’re bullshitting me. I called your office and you never even came in.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, vulgar, slang) To have casual conversation with no real point; to shoot the breeze.
examples: I will probably just go and bullshit with Joe for awhile.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, vulgar, slang) To come up with on the spot; to improvise.
examples: We just went on stage and bullshitted the whole concert because we didn't know any songs.
